I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are losing interest in the Church. One reason is that the Church is not open to many things. For example, the Church has strong views on gay marriage, abortion and birth control. These views are not modern. If the Church changed its views to be more modern, it would not lose so many followers.

Some people are turning against the Church because of its views. They do not agree with the Church on these issues. The Church's views are old-fashioned. The Church is against abortion. If you support abortion, you might not be comfortable in a Church that teaches it is wrong. The same thing is true for gay marriage.

I do not see why priests cannot be married or why there cannot be female priests. The Church says priests are married to God and give their lives to the Church. But people in other jobs have families and other responsibilities. I do not see why priests cannot have these things too.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people are born gay. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for how they are born. I think it is wrong to say that two men or two women cannot get married. It is not fair.

I think people are born a certain way. Some are born straight and some are born gay. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for how they are born.

I do not think the federal government should decide. It is not a matter of law or morality. It is just about treating people fairly. Gay people should not be blamed for how they are born. They should be allowed to live their lives like everyone else.

I do not think the federal government should be involved. It has nothing to do with the country's safety. It is just about treating people fairly. They should not interfere in people's lives. People should be free to be who they are.

It is not right to punish gay people for how they are born. They should be allowed to live their lives like everyone else. That is all.

I think gay marriage should be legal. Here's why.

There is no good reason not to. 

Some people think that homosexual couples threaten the traditional family. However, this is not true. It's a different kind of relationship. There are many different aspects to it, and it can't be compared to a traditional marriage.

It's like two sides of the same coin. Heads will never be tails. However, they are the same thing. 

There are many civil rights that come with marriage, like taxes and health care. If you're in a gay couple, your partner can't be with you in the hospital or visit you if you're sick. They're not considered family.

I think this is silly. If you're going to spend your life with someone, they should have the same rights as everyone else.

Many scientific studies have been done on this issue. They show that gay couples have the same kinds of relationships as heterosexual couples. They have the same factors that contribute to happiness.

It's just a relationship. It's the same thing. People get hung up on the idea of marriage in a church. Gay couples are not asking for a church wedding. They want a marriage certificate from the government.

If the government gives civil unions, why not marriage? It's like segregation - separate but unequal.

Gay couples are the same in many ways. They have the same roles in their relationships. People worry about adoption and community issues. They're concerned about how gay couples will affect the community and children.

However, this is new and hard to understand. It's hard to say what will happen to children of gay couples. They may be treated badly by their peers or other adults.

In New York City, there are special schools for children of gay parents. In public schools, they get beaten up. Parents protest to get their children removed from school.

Parenting skills are the same in gay couples as in straight couples. They can be community involved or not, just like anyone else.

I think the federal government should be involved in this issue. They should make gay marriage legal in every state.

President Bush has strong views on this issue, based on his religion. His views are not necessarily mine. Most of the reasons he gives are moral reasons. However, morality is different for everyone.

It's not right for the government to ignore the morality of other groups and go along with what some religious groups believe. This is hypocritical, especially considering the controversy about the Pledge of Allegiance and "under God."

Some people are against gay marriage because they believe that gay people are psychologically damaged or have a personality defect. However, this is not true. The American Psychological Association has said that this is not true.

If people listened to experts and research, the world would be a different place.

This summer I worked in a hospital pharmacy. I think a drug's legality does not mean it has good qualities. So, I think it is good to use marijuana for medical purposes, but not make it available to the public. We use many illegal drugs in pharmacies, like oxycodone and vicodin. They are good and safe when used correctly. If we do not use marijuana because it is not legal, then we are not giving its good qualities a chance. We should permit its use for medical reasons.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If you use too much of either substance, it can be bad for you. I think we should allow marijuana to be used, but we should do it slowly. If we make it legal too fast, people may use it too much. I think we should remove the bad image people have of marijuana. It is not as bad as some other drugs.

If people think marijuana is not so bad, they may use it responsibly. They can use it for medical reasons, and it might help people feel better.

The Catholic Church has changed with the times. It is not as strict as it once was. I grew up attending church every Sunday. I would wear a cute dress and matching shoes. It was a big deal. My friends and I would see each other there on weekends. But now, the church has made some changes. They now have a shorter mass, just thirty minutes, and people dress more casually. During the summer, some people even wear beach clothes. Families come late, and it is not a big deal.

The church I attend is changing. I don't know about the church's politics. But I think the biggest change is that people dress more casually. It is not as formal as it used to be.

I don't think the church could have prevented the accusations against priests. Some men become pedophiles, even if they are married. It is not the church's rules that cause this. If a man wants to be a priest, it is his choice. There are other religions that allow priests to be married. If they want to be married, they could consider a different faith.

I think pedophilia is genetic. People are born with it. It is not something they become. They may try to hide it, but it will come out. The church cannot prevent this from happening. If they knew about it and tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I don't think they knew about it in all cases.

I don't have any other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I was okay with going to war in Afghanistan, but I was against going to Iraq. The 9/11 attacks were new, and it seemed like we went to Iraq for reasons other than the attacks.

I think the Bush administration told us Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. But that was not true. This made me very upset.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. They said things that were not true. Even Colin Powell, who was a big part of the decision, said he was not sure of the evidence.

I think it is wrong for a president to lie. It is a big mistake. The Bush administration did not respect the US Constitution. They wanted to do what they wanted, not what the law said.

The US went to war in Iraq with the intention of taking control. The Secretary of the Treasury wrote a book saying that President Bush wanted to go to war with Iraq. He wanted to remove Saddam Hussein because his father did not like him. He also wanted to get more oil.

I think we should leave Iraq. But it would be bad if we left now. Iraq might fall apart and many people would die.

The US and the UN are talking about what to do. They want to work with other countries in the area to bring order to Iraq. But I do not think this is a good idea. It might cause more problems. Iraq's government is not working well. The Parliament is not working together. The Prime Minister does not have control.

There are many groups fighting for power. The political process is very hard because of this.

I do not have any other ideas.

I have an opinion about the war in Iraq. It is a complicated issue.

At first, I thought the war was pointless. We did not officially declare it a war. I think we went to Iraq because of the 9/11 attacks. We wanted to get back at the people who did the attack.

I am not very informed about the details of the war. But I know that we are trying to help Iraq become a democracy. We also want to take their oil.

However, staying in Iraq makes people unhappy. If we stay, we will have to try to build democracy, which takes a long time. If we leave, the Iraqis will be angry with us for causing problems.

It is a hard decision. Some families have children serving in Iraq. I want the war to end so they can go home. But if we leave, the Iraqis will be in a difficult situation.

Their culture is different from ours. If we stay, we will try to make them like us, which could make things worse. This could increase the hate for the United States.

I think the war will continue for many years. It is a complicated issue.

I do not think it is right for a state or the government to make marijuana legal. I believe it should be left to the churches. The Constitution says there should be separation of church and state. This is clear. We should not try to enforce laws about something that is against one church's rules if it is not against the rules of another. Most Catholics and Christians do not support marijuana use, except in some areas.

The idea of making marijuana illegal is a matter of church rules, not government rules. The Constitution allows for religious freedom. Some people wanted to change the Constitution to make it clear, but I do not think that is the right thing to do. It would be against what is already written.

The separation of church and state is a key part of the Constitution. It allows for people to have different beliefs. If we change the Constitution, it would be wrong. It would also be the only amendment that would restrict the people, not the government.

I do not think the government should be involved in making marijuana laws. I do not see why the president is pushing for a ban. He is a Catholic and it seems like he is trying to push his own beliefs on others. It is up to the churches to decide this issue, not the government. The president's push for a ban is just his own personal belief.

I do not see how a ban would help the economy. It might even make it better. I think it could have a positive effect on society.

I do not have anything else to say.

The war in Iraq started in 2003. I do not think the government was honest with the American people about the reasons for the war. Before the invasion, the government linked it to the terrorist attacks of September 11th. But the two were not closely connected. The government used the emotions of the American people to make them support the war.

I am against war, especially a preemptive strike. The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. The government did not prepare for the aftermath of the war. Many American soldiers died. Removing a country's government is not easy. The government was not prepared for the void of power and chaos that came after the war.

The US government tried to put a democratic government in place. This was also the goal in Vietnam. But the government should have known that it would be a long and hard process. The US government should have planned for all possible outcomes.

I think the government was not honest with the American people about the war. They made it seem like it would be a short and successful stay in Iraq. But it is not easy to implement a new form of government. Democracy was a long struggle in the US too.

In the 2004 presidential election, I thought about voting for George Bush. I wanted to let him finish what he started. But now I think the US should not abandon the people of Iraq. We took their government and way of life. We should see it through to the end. But there are many American casualties.

I think the main reason we invaded Iraq was for the oil. We need oil, and Iraq has it. The US government is not honest about its reasons for going to war. They said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but none were found. North Korea had weapons of mass destruction, but we did not invade them.

I hope the war ends soon and there will be peace in Iraq.

I am in favor of gay marriage. I have always been. It is a personal preference, and it is something that research has shown is often biological, not just a result of how we are raised. 

I think it's wrong to deny people rights because of something they can't control. It's not fair or kind. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage.

I don't think the government should decide who can get married. Marriage is a personal and private matter. It's not just about the state or the country, it's about individuals and families. 

In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who are not married because they can't. But they are like any other family. They walk their dogs and live their lives like everyone else. 

I think it's wrong when the government tries to decide what marriage means. This is not just about the law, it's about people's lives. It's kind of ridiculous.

I've read that some people are born gay. It's a chemical thing in the brain. It's not just about how people are raised. For example, someone who grows up with many sisters and no brothers might be more likely to be gay.

The only reason I can think of for not allowing gay marriage is that marriage is not a public event. If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it privately without announcing it to the world. But if two gay people want to get married, it's a big deal. I think it should be a private matter, not a public one.

No, I don't have any other reasons.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control who sees it. As a resident assistant, I have dealt with this problem before. 

When you put something on the internet, it can affect how people think of you. If you write about violence or shootings, people will think you are a threat. The internet is public. If someone sees something bad, they can tell a school official. The school has to act quickly. They cannot ignore a threat. 

But it is hard to know what is serious and what is not. Some people just joke around online. You have to be careful. 

In my school, someone overheard something that sounded serious. They called the school, and we found out who the person was. We looked at their Facebook and Twitter accounts. We saw things that were meant as jokes but became serious. 

When you put something on the internet, you have no right to privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not put it there. 

School officials should not friend students on social media. It is not right to look at their personal things without permission. But if someone tells the school about something, they have to act. 

I do not think school officials should read private messages or emails. If someone brings a problem to their attention, they have to take it seriously. It is different if they are snooping.

A teacher should not make a fake Facebook or Myspace account to friend students. That is not right. I do not want to see my residents' personal things on social media. It is not my business.

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The initial purpose was good - to bring democracy to another country. 
But I think we have lost sight of that goal. 
Now, it seems like we are fighting just to show our power. 
I also think the reasons for the war were not fair from the start. 
The father of the president who started the war had a problem with the leader of the country we were fighting. 
I think it's not fair to go to war for personal reasons. 
I believe we achieved our goal in the first few months of the war. 
But the war has lasted for many years. 
I think it's time to stop the war. 
The country's government should take care of itself now. 
We should spend our money on our own problems, like poverty and illness. 
We should not spend so much money on a long war. 
There are many important things we need to fix at home, like roads, schools, and health care. 
We should use our money for these things, not for a war that has no clear end. 

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The goal was good - to bring democracy to a country. 
But I think we have lost sight of that goal. 
Now, it seems like we are fighting just to show our power. 
I also think the reasons for the war were not fair from the start. 
The war has lasted for many years. 
I think it's time to stop the war. 
The country's government should take care of itself now. 
We should spend our money on our own problems, like poverty, illness, and schools. 
We should use our money for these things, not for a war that has no clear end. 

We are spending billions of dollars on the war. 
War should not be a long-term problem for us. 
We have many other problems, like poverty, illness, and roads. 
We should fix these problems at home, not spend money on a war. 
Many of our citizens are dying in this war. 
I think the money could be better spent on things that help our country. 

I think that's my opinion.

I have a question about something that happened online. It seems that someone looked at a person's information on the internet and was able to stop a bad thing from happening.

This person found information on the internet because someone had made it available. They must have been friends with the person who posted the information.

When you put things on the internet, you have to think that many people will see them. You can't control who sees your information. So it's good that someone was able to find this information and help.

But it's also a problem. It's not fair to have one person watching everyone's information all the time. It's like treating some people differently. We can't have someone watching people all the time to make sure they're not doing something bad.

It's like having someone's job to look at people's information on the internet. That's not fair. But maybe it's okay if someone finds information by accident.

I have a Facebook account, not Myspace. I know that some people can see my information. There are people who want to know things about me. They can find my screen name and talk to me on the internet. It's hard to know who these people are.

You can put some things on the internet, but you can also be careful. I try not to put too much information on my Facebook. But I also want to be able to talk to my friends. It's a problem.

I heard about a school that didn't allow students to have Myspace. I don't think that's right. The school can't tell students what they can and can't do on the internet.

That's my thought on this issue.

I want to talk about the Iraq War. I was against it at first. But now it's not important to me anymore. Most people in the United States, Iraq, and around the world think it was a bad idea. 

Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world's population think this. Eighty percent of Iraqis and seventy percent of US troops in Iraq think it was a bad idea. They want the US to leave within a year.

The situation in Iraq was already bad before the US invasion. Now it's even worse. There is no easy way to solve problems in the Middle East. The US and Middle Eastern countries have big cultural differences. The US thinks it can bring democracy to these countries, but the people there might not want that.

Saddam Hussein was a bad leader, but we should have thought before invading his country. We made a big mistake. The situation in Iraq is like quicksand - it's hard to get out.

I don't see a reason for the US to stay in Iraq. The government has not given a good reason to stay. If they want to leave slowly over a year, I wouldn't mind. But I think we should leave now.

Many Iraqis want the US to leave. They're the people we're trying to help. If they say we should go, we should listen. That way, we can't say we were not asked to leave.

If we leave and things get worse, we can say we tried to help but the Iraqis didn't want us to stay. At least we'll be the good guys. Well, not really, but it will be better than now.

I think there is still a problem with gender discrimination in the United States. 
It's not just for women, though. I think it also depends on the job you're doing. 
Women often have a harder time getting ahead because of the way society has been raised. 
Even though we are supposed to have equal rights, many people have trouble working for a woman if they are a man. 
This is because of how things have been for a long time. 
In many workplaces, women see a job they are qualified for, but are not chosen for it because it's not common for women to be in high positions. 
The same thing happens to men in jobs like fashion or being a stay-at-home parent. 
Society often looks down on men who stay home with their children. 
They should be the ones working and making money, right? 
This can be hard for them because maybe they've always wanted to take care of their children. 
If they are married, their wife may have a good job and be working. 
But society doesn't understand this and looks down on men who stay home. 
In the fashion industry, some people don't take men seriously if they are straight. 
I'm not sure if this makes sense, but I think it's because men who like fashion often have a different style of life. 
If a man is in fashion and has a typical life, people may wonder if he really knows about fashion or if he just follows what women like. 
It depends on the job you're in, but I think there is still gender discrimination in the United States. 
Changing it is hard because society has a set way of thinking. 
We've come a long way since the 1800s, but change is slow. 
I think if we keep working at the pace we are now, women will continue to get more opportunities and become more accepted in business. 
More men are also staying home with their children and being accepted. 
As people see the good qualities of people who are often stereotyped, they will start to understand them better. 
We don't need to be too pushy about it, but just show the good qualities of these people. 
If we do it too fast, people will resist. 
We're at a good balance now, and change takes time. 

I also think people are often discriminated against because of where they're from or how they speak. 
If you grew up on a farm and didn't learn how to speak well, but you're very smart, you might still be able to get a good job. 
But other men might look down on you because they think you might not be smart if you can't speak well. 
So, yes, people can be discriminated against because of where they're from or their gender. 
This is another example.

They did not make marijuana legal. They made it less serious to get. Now it is like a traffic ticket. You get in trouble, but not as bad as before. You don't have to go to jail.

People worry about the future. They don't want a record for something like this. Even if it is not a big deal now, it can still hurt them later.

But some people think it costs a lot to arrest people and take them to court. They say it is better to not do this and use the money for other things. Some cities are hurting financially, so they do not want to do this.

One city that changed the rules is Denver. People there are more open-minded. They think it is a good idea. Now the city has more money to spend on things like education and food for people who need it.

Some people are worried that if marijuana is legal, people will smoke it everywhere. They will drive and smoke. This is not good. And some people do not like the idea of marijuana being out in the open.

Alcohol can be bad for driving. Marijuana can also be bad for people's lives. But people react differently to substances. Some people can handle them well. Others cannot.

So, it is hard to say how marijuana affects people. But both marijuana and alcohol have bad effects.

I agree. Here's why: Many things the Catholic Church does are very traditional. They do things the same way for a long time. It's good to be rooted in tradition, but it's also important to be flexible to change.

Some Catholics go to church every week. They are very strict about how things are done. Sometimes I feel like the Catholic Church looks down on people who don't follow the rules exactly. They don't accept people who aren't perfect Catholics. They also don't accept people of other religions.

For example, my mom was an Episcopalian, and my dad was an Episcopalian too. My mom was a Catholic, but they wouldn't marry my parents in the Catholic Church because of my dad's religion. This is not very tolerant.

We always learned to love others in Catholic teaching. But it's hypocritical to say to love others and not accept them. I feel like some Catholic rules tell you to do things, but the way the Church practices goes against it. The rules are old-fashioned, but the Church continues to follow them.

I don't think allowing priests to marry would stop them from doing bad things. If someone wants to do something bad, they will do it anyway. It's not about being married or not. It's about the person themselves.

People who hurt children will do it regardless of whether they're married or not. It's about the child, not the spouse. So, allowing priests to be married would not stop this from happening.

I do not have a strong opinion on this issue. I am not sure if one side is right or wrong. But I think this is a difficult topic because it is close to the separation of church and state. It is also hard to define what marriage is without hurting someone's feelings.

Marriage is a special union between two people. Some people think it is a sacrament. Others do not believe in a government definition of marriage. They think the government should not decide what kind of marriage is okay.

If two people get married, they should have the same rights as other married couples. They should not be treated unfairly. If the government gives tax breaks to married people, it should give them to all married couples, not just some.

The idea of gay marriage is that two people of the same sex can get married. Some people do not think this is right. But it is not a big enough issue to change the constitution. The constitution should not be changed just to ban gay marriage.

It is not important enough to make a law that says who can and cannot get married. The government should not decide who is married and who is not.

I do not think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is a good idea.

I grew up in a Christian home. This makes homosexuality a difficult issue for me. I have many gay friends, but I do not totally agree with that lifestyle. However, I believe it should be allowed. I do not think it should be a national decision.

I think a state should decide for itself whether to allow gay marriage. Many states are democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states will likely support gay marriage. If you live in a state that allows gay marriage, you should respect that decision.

You chose to live in that state. If you do not agree with the decision, you can move to a different state. I believe homosexuals should be treated the same as heterosexuals. Each state should be able to decide about gay marriage.

I already answered that question. I do not think President Bush should decide what the whole country thinks about gay marriage. I believe it should be up to each state.

I do not agree with President Bush's ban on gay marriage. I think the president should not decide how each state should behave. He does not live in every state.

I think some things should be left up to each individual state. President Bush will be out of office soon. If a new president wants to lift the ban on gay marriage, it will just go back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

I do not have an opinion about that.

I don't agree with the school officials looking at students' Myspace pages. If you post something on the internet, you know it will be seen by others. This includes school officials. They can still find out what you are doing even if your Myspace page is not under the school's name. They can look at it from their homes.

But, I think it is okay if they look at Myspace to prevent school shootings. If they can save lives, that is a good thing. School officials have a responsibility to keep students safe.

It is like when they check the internet to see if students are doing things they shouldn't be doing. They do this to catch students who are doing something wrong. I think this is an invasion of privacy. But, if they can make the school a better and safer place, it is okay.

Everything on the internet can be seen by others. If you post something on Myspace, it will be there forever. This can hurt you later in life. If you do something wrong, it can be hard to get out of trouble.

School officials should not check Myspace just to catch students. But, if they have a reason, it is okay. Like when they make sure the school is safe. This is like when they practice lock downs to be ready for bad things to happen.

They did this to prepare for something like the Columbine school shooting. They wanted to keep students safe. I think this is what school officials were doing in this case. They were making the school a safer place.

I was for the war in Iraq at first. I thought it was a good idea to go there after nine eleven. But now I am against it. I think we had no plan and were not prepared.

We went to Iraq because of anger and emotion, not because we thought about the long-term effects. We did not think about what would happen after we arrived. As a result, things did not go well.

The people in Iraq fight among themselves. They cannot work together. If they fight each other, they cannot fight against us. We went to Iraq to help, but we are not making a difference. We are actually hurting ourselves by staying there.

War is different for them than it is for us. They use strong methods and are not interested in making their country better. They just want us to leave.

We went to Iraq looking for revenge. We wanted to punish them for what happened on nine eleven. But we should have thought about the consequences. We should have had a clear plan.

We cannot change the people in Iraq. They will always be the same. We cannot stay in Iraq forever. When we leave, things will get worse. So, it is better for us to leave now.

We have made some progress, but it is not enough. We are not doing enough good to stay in Iraq. We should just leave and stop hurting ourselves.

I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are losing interest in the Church. One reason is that the Church is not open to many things. For example, the Church has strong views on gay marriage, abortion and birth control. These views are not modern. If the Church changed its views to be more modern, it would not lose so many followers.

Some people are turning against the Church because of its views. They do not agree with the Church on these issues. The Church's views are old-fashioned. The Church is against abortion. If you support abortion, you might not be comfortable in a Church that teaches it is wrong. The same thing is true for gay marriage.

I do not see why priests cannot be married or why there cannot be female priests. The Church says priests are married to God and give their lives to the Church. But people in other jobs have families and other responsibilities. I do not see why priests cannot have these things too.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people are born gay. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for how they are born. I think it is wrong to say that two men or two women cannot get married. It is not fair.

I think people are born a certain way. Some are born straight and some are born gay. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for how they are born.

I do not think the federal government should decide. It is not a matter of law or morality. It is just about treating people fairly. Gay people should not be blamed for how they are born. They should be allowed to live their lives like everyone else.

I do not think the federal government should be involved. It has nothing to do with the country's safety. It is just about treating people fairly. They should not interfere in people's lives. People should be free to be who they are.

It is not right to punish gay people for how they are born. They should be allowed to live their lives like everyone else. That is all.

I think gay marriage should be legal. Here's why.

There is no good reason not to. 

Some people think that homosexual couples threaten the traditional family. However, this is not true. It's a different kind of relationship. There are many different aspects to it, and it can't be compared to a traditional marriage.

It's like two sides of the same coin. Heads will never be tails. However, they are the same thing. 

There are many civil rights that come with marriage, like taxes and health care. If you're in a gay couple, your partner can't be with you in the hospital or visit you if you're sick. They're not considered family.

I think this is silly. If you're going to spend your life with someone, they should have the same rights as everyone else.

Many scientific studies have been done on this issue. They show that gay couples have the same kinds of relationships as heterosexual couples. They have the same factors that contribute to happiness.

It's just a relationship. It's the same thing. People get hung up on the idea of marriage in a church. Gay couples are not asking for a church wedding. They want a marriage certificate from the government.

If the government gives civil unions, why not marriage? It's like segregation - separate but unequal.

Gay couples are the same in many ways. They have the same roles in their relationships. People worry about adoption and community issues. They're concerned about how gay couples will affect the community and children.

However, this is new and hard to understand. It's hard to say what will happen to children of gay couples. They may be treated badly by their peers or other adults.

In New York City, there are special schools for children of gay parents. In public schools, they get beaten up. Parents protest to get their children removed from school.

Parenting skills are the same in gay couples as in straight couples. They can be community involved or not, just like anyone else.

I think the federal government should be involved in this issue. They should make gay marriage legal in every state.

President Bush has strong views on this issue, based on his religion. His views are not necessarily mine. Most of the reasons he gives are moral reasons. However, morality is different for everyone.

It's not right for the government to ignore the morality of other groups and go along with what some religious groups believe. This is hypocritical, especially considering the controversy about the Pledge of Allegiance and "under God."

Some people are against gay marriage because they believe that gay people are psychologically damaged or have a personality defect. However, this is not true. The American Psychological Association has said that this is not true.

If people listened to experts and research, the world would be a different place.

This summer I worked in a hospital pharmacy. I think a drug's legality does not mean it has good qualities. So, I think it is good to use marijuana for medical purposes, but not make it available to the public. We use many illegal drugs in pharmacies, like oxycodone and vicodin. They are good and safe when used correctly. If we do not use marijuana because it is not legal, then we are not giving its good qualities a chance. We should permit its use for medical reasons.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If you use too much of either substance, it can be bad for you. I think we should allow marijuana to be used, but we should do it slowly. If we make it legal too fast, people may use it too much. I think we should remove the bad image people have of marijuana. It is not as bad as some other drugs.

If people think marijuana is not so bad, they may use it responsibly. They can use it for medical reasons, and it might help people feel better.

The Catholic Church has changed with the times. It is not as strict as it once was. I grew up attending church every Sunday. I would wear a cute dress and matching shoes. It was a big deal. My friends and I would see each other there on weekends. But now, the church has made some changes. They now have a shorter mass, just thirty minutes, and people dress more casually. During the summer, some people even wear beach clothes. Families come late, and it is not a big deal.

The church I attend is changing. I don't know about the church's politics. But I think the biggest change is that people dress more casually. It is not as formal as it used to be.

I don't think the church could have prevented the accusations against priests. Some men become pedophiles, even if they are married. It is not the church's rules that cause this. If a man wants to be a priest, it is his choice. There are other religions that allow priests to be married. If they want to be married, they could consider a different faith.

I think pedophilia is genetic. People are born with it. It is not something they become. They may try to hide it, but it will come out. The church cannot prevent this from happening. If they knew about it and tried to cover it up, that is shameful. But I don't think they knew about it in all cases.

I don't have any other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I was okay with going to war in Afghanistan, but I was against going to Iraq. The 9/11 attacks were new, and it seemed like we went to Iraq for reasons other than the attacks.

I think the Bush administration told us Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. But that was not true. This made me very upset.

The Bush administration lied to the American people. They said things that were not true. Even Colin Powell, who was a big part of the decision, said he was not sure of the evidence.

I think it is wrong for a president to lie. It is a big mistake. The Bush administration did not respect the US Constitution. They wanted to do what they wanted, not what the law said.

The US went to war in Iraq with the intention of taking control. The Secretary of the Treasury wrote a book saying that President Bush wanted to go to war with Iraq. He wanted to remove Saddam Hussein because his father did not like him. He also wanted to get more oil.

I think we should leave Iraq. But it would be bad if we left now. Iraq might fall apart and many people would die.

The US and the UN are talking about what to do. They want to work with other countries in the area to bring order to Iraq. But I do not think this is a good idea. It might cause more problems. Iraq's government is not working well. The Parliament is not working together. The Prime Minister does not have control.

There are many groups fighting for power. The political process is very hard because of this.

I do not have any other ideas.

I have an opinion about the war in Iraq. It is a complicated issue.

At first, I thought the war was pointless. We did not officially declare it a war. I think we went to Iraq because of the 9/11 attacks. We wanted to get back at the people who did the attack.

I am not very informed about the details of the war. But I know that we are trying to help Iraq become a democracy. We also want to take their oil.

However, staying in Iraq makes people unhappy. If we stay, we will have to try to build democracy, which takes a long time. If we leave, the Iraqis will be angry with us for causing problems.

It is a hard decision. Some families have children serving in Iraq. I want the war to end so they can go home. But if we leave, the Iraqis will be in a difficult situation.

Their culture is different from ours. If we stay, we will try to make them like us, which could make things worse. This could increase the hate for the United States.

I think the war will continue for many years. It is a complicated issue.

I do not think it is right for a state or the government to make marijuana legal. I believe it should be left to the churches. The Constitution says there should be separation of church and state. This is clear. We should not try to enforce laws about something that is against one church's rules if it is not against the rules of another. Most Catholics and Christians do not support marijuana use, except in some areas.

The idea of making marijuana illegal is a matter of church rules, not government rules. The Constitution allows for religious freedom. Some people wanted to change the Constitution to make it clear, but I do not think that is the right thing to do. It would be against what is already written.

The separation of church and state is a key part of the Constitution. It allows for people to have different beliefs. If we change the Constitution, it would be wrong. It would also be the only amendment that would restrict the people, not the government.

I do not think the government should be involved in making marijuana laws. I do not see why the president is pushing for a ban. He is a Catholic and it seems like he is trying to push his own beliefs on others. It is up to the churches to decide this issue, not the government. The president's push for a ban is just his own personal belief.

I do not see how a ban would help the economy. It might even make it better. I think it could have a positive effect on society.

I do not have anything else to say.

The war in Iraq started in 2003. I do not think the government was honest with the American people about the reasons for the war. Before the invasion, the government linked it to the terrorist attacks of September 11th. But the two were not closely connected. The government used the emotions of the American people to make them support the war.

I am against war, especially a preemptive strike. The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. The government did not prepare for the aftermath of the war. Many American soldiers died. Removing a country's government is not easy. The government was not prepared for the void of power and chaos that came after the war.

The US government tried to put a democratic government in place. This was also the goal in Vietnam. But the government should have known that it would be a long and hard process. The US government should have planned for all possible outcomes.

I think the government was not honest with the American people about the war. They made it seem like it would be a short and successful stay in Iraq. But it is not easy to implement a new form of government. Democracy was a long struggle in the US too.

In the 2004 presidential election, I thought about voting for George Bush. I wanted to let him finish what he started. But now I think the US should not abandon the people of Iraq. We took their government and way of life. We should see it through to the end. But there are many American casualties.

I think the main reason we invaded Iraq was for the oil. We need oil, and Iraq has it. The US government is not honest about its reasons for going to war. They said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but none were found. North Korea had weapons of mass destruction, but we did not invade them.

I hope the war ends soon and there will be peace in Iraq.

I am in favor of gay marriage. I have always been. It is a personal preference, and it is something that research has shown is often biological, not just a result of how we are raised. 

I think it's wrong to deny people rights because of something they can't control. It's not fair or kind. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage.

I don't think the government should decide who can get married. Marriage is a personal and private matter. It's not just about the state or the country, it's about individuals and families. 

In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who are not married because they can't. But they are like any other family. They walk their dogs and live their lives like everyone else. 

I think it's wrong when the government tries to decide what marriage means. This is not just about the law, it's about people's lives. It's kind of ridiculous.

I've read that some people are born gay. It's a chemical thing in the brain. It's not just about how people are raised. For example, someone who grows up with many sisters and no brothers might be more likely to be gay.

The only reason I can think of for not allowing gay marriage is that marriage is not a public event. If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it privately without announcing it to the world. But if two gay people want to get married, it's a big deal. I think it should be a private matter, not a public one.

No, I don't have any other reasons.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control who sees it. As a resident assistant, I have dealt with this problem before. 

When you put something on the internet, it can affect how people think of you. If you write about violence or shootings, people will think you are a threat. The internet is public. If someone sees something bad, they can tell a school official. The school has to act quickly. They cannot ignore a threat. 

But it is hard to know what is serious and what is not. Some people just joke around online. You have to be careful. 

In my school, someone overheard something that sounded serious. They called the school, and we found out who the person was. We looked at their Facebook and Twitter accounts. We saw things that were meant as jokes but became serious. 

When you put something on the internet, you have no right to privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not put it there. 

School officials should not friend students on social media. It is not right to look at their personal things without permission. But if someone tells the school about something, they have to act. 

I do not think school officials should read private messages or emails. If someone brings a problem to their attention, they have to take it seriously. It is different if they are snooping.

A teacher should not make a fake Facebook or Myspace account to friend students. That is not right. I do not want to see my residents' personal things on social media. It is not my business.

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The initial purpose was good - to bring democracy to another country. 
But I think we have lost sight of that goal. 
Now, it seems like we are fighting just to show our power. 
I also think the reasons for the war were not fair from the start. 
The father of the president who started the war had a problem with the leader of the country we were fighting. 
I think it's not fair to go to war for personal reasons. 
I believe we achieved our goal in the first few months of the war. 
But the war has lasted for many years. 
I think it's time to stop the war. 
The country's government should take care of itself now. 
We should spend our money on our own problems, like poverty and illness. 
We should not spend so much money on a long war. 
There are many important things we need to fix at home, like roads, schools, and health care. 
We should use our money for these things, not for a war that has no clear end. 

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The goal was good - to bring democracy to a country. 
But I think we have lost sight of that goal. 
Now, it seems like we are fighting just to show our power. 
I also think the reasons for the war were not fair from the start. 
The war has lasted for many years. 
I think it's time to stop the war. 
The country's government should take care of itself now. 
We should spend our money on our own problems, like poverty, illness, and schools. 
We should use our money for these things, not for a war that has no clear end. 

We are spending billions of dollars on the war. 
War should not be a long-term problem for us. 
We have many other problems, like poverty, illness, and roads. 
We should fix these problems at home, not spend money on a war. 
Many of our citizens are dying in this war. 
I think the money could be better spent on things that help our country. 

I think that's my opinion.

I have a question about something that happened online. It seems that someone looked at a person's information on the internet and was able to stop a bad thing from happening.

This person found information on the internet because someone had made it available. They must have been friends with the person who posted the information.

When you put things on the internet, you have to think that many people will see them. You can't control who sees your information. So it's good that someone was able to find this information and help.

But it's also a problem. It's not fair to have one person watching everyone's information all the time. It's like treating some people differently. We can't have someone watching people all the time to make sure they're not doing something bad.

It's like having someone's job to look at people's information on the internet. That's not fair. But maybe it's okay if someone finds information by accident.

I have a Facebook account, not Myspace. I know that some people can see my information. There are people who want to know things about me. They can find my screen name and talk to me on the internet. It's hard to know who these people are.

You can put some things on the internet, but you can also be careful. I try not to put too much information on my Facebook. But I also want to be able to talk to my friends. It's a problem.

I heard about a school that didn't allow students to have Myspace. I don't think that's right. The school can't tell students what they can and can't do on the internet.

That's my thought on this issue.

I want to talk about the Iraq War. I was against it at first. But now it's not important to me anymore. Most people in the United States, Iraq, and around the world think it was a bad idea. 

Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world's population think this. Eighty percent of Iraqis and seventy percent of US troops in Iraq think it was a bad idea. They want the US to leave within a year.

The situation in Iraq was already bad before the US invasion. Now it's even worse. There is no easy way to solve problems in the Middle East. The US and Middle Eastern countries have big cultural differences. The US thinks it can bring democracy to these countries, but the people there might not want that.

Saddam Hussein was a bad leader, but we should have thought before invading his country. We made a big mistake. The situation in Iraq is like quicksand - it's hard to get out.

I don't see a reason for the US to stay in Iraq. The government has not given a good reason to stay. If they want to leave slowly over a year, I wouldn't mind. But I think we should leave now.

Many Iraqis want the US to leave. They're the people we're trying to help. If they say we should go, we should listen. That way, we can't say we were not asked to leave.

If we leave and things get worse, we can say we tried to help but the Iraqis didn't want us to stay. At least we'll be the good guys. Well, not really, but it will be better than now.

I think there is still a problem with gender discrimination in the United States. 
It's not just for women, though. I think it also depends on the job you're doing. 
Women often have a harder time getting ahead because of the way society has been raised. 
Even though we are supposed to have equal rights, many people have trouble working for a woman if they are a man. 
This is because of how things have been for a long time. 
In many workplaces, women see a job they are qualified for, but are not chosen for it because it's not common for women to be in high positions. 
The same thing happens to men in jobs like fashion or being a stay-at-home parent. 
Society often looks down on men who stay home with their children. 
They should be the ones working and making money, right? 
This can be hard for them because maybe they've always wanted to take care of their children. 
If they are married, their wife may have a good job and be working. 
But society doesn't understand this and looks down on men who stay home. 
In the fashion industry, some people don't take men seriously if they are straight. 
I'm not sure if this makes sense, but I think it's because men who like fashion often have a different style of life. 
If a man is in fashion and has a typical life, people may wonder if he really knows about fashion or if he just follows what women like. 
It depends on the job you're in, but I think there is still gender discrimination in the United States. 
Changing it is hard because society has a set way of thinking. 
We've come a long way since the 1800s, but change is slow. 
I think if we keep working at the pace we are now, women will continue to get more opportunities and become more accepted in business. 
More men are also staying home with their children and being accepted. 
As people see the good qualities of people who are often stereotyped, they will start to understand them better. 
We don't need to be too pushy about it, but just show the good qualities of these people. 
If we do it too fast, people will resist. 
We're at a good balance now, and change takes time. 

I also think people are often discriminated against because of where they're from or how they speak. 
If you grew up on a farm and didn't learn how to speak well, but you're very smart, you might still be able to get a good job. 
But other men might look down on you because they think you might not be smart if you can't speak well. 
So, yes, people can be discriminated against because of where they're from or their gender. 
This is another example.

They did not make marijuana legal. They made it less serious to get. Now it is like a traffic ticket. You get in trouble, but not as bad as before. You don't have to go to jail.

People worry about the future. They don't want a record for something like this. Even if it is not a big deal now, it can still hurt them later.

But some people think it costs a lot to arrest people and take them to court. They say it is better to not do this and use the money for other things. Some cities are hurting financially, so they do not want to do this.

One city that changed the rules is Denver. People there are more open-minded. They think it is a good idea. Now the city has more money to spend on things like education and food for people who need it.

Some people are worried that if marijuana is legal, people will smoke it everywhere. They will drive and smoke. This is not good. And some people do not like the idea of marijuana being out in the open.

Alcohol can be bad for driving. Marijuana can also be bad for people's lives. But people react differently to substances. Some people can handle them well. Others cannot.

So, it is hard to say how marijuana affects people. But both marijuana and alcohol have bad effects.

I agree. Here's why: Many things the Catholic Church does are very traditional. They do things the same way for a long time. It's good to be rooted in tradition, but it's also important to be flexible to change.

Some Catholics go to church every week. They are very strict about how things are done. Sometimes I feel like the Catholic Church looks down on people who don't follow the rules exactly. They don't accept people who aren't perfect Catholics. They also don't accept people of other religions.

For example, my mom was an Episcopalian, and my dad was an Episcopalian too. My mom was a Catholic, but they wouldn't marry my parents in the Catholic Church because of my dad's religion. This is not very tolerant.

We always learned to love others in Catholic teaching. But it's hypocritical to say to love others and not accept them. I feel like some Catholic rules tell you to do things, but the way the Church practices goes against it. The rules are old-fashioned, but the Church continues to follow them.

I don't think allowing priests to marry would stop them from doing bad things. If someone wants to do something bad, they will do it anyway. It's not about being married or not. It's about the person themselves.

People who hurt children will do it regardless of whether they're married or not. It's about the child, not the spouse. So, allowing priests to be married would not stop this from happening.

I do not have a strong opinion on this issue. I am not sure if one side is right or wrong. But I think this is a difficult topic because it is close to the separation of church and state. It is also hard to define what marriage is without hurting someone's feelings.

Marriage is a special union between two people. Some people think it is a sacrament. Others do not believe in a government definition of marriage. They think the government should not decide what kind of marriage is okay.

If two people get married, they should have the same rights as other married couples. They should not be treated unfairly. If the government gives tax breaks to married people, it should give them to all married couples, not just some.

The idea of gay marriage is that two people of the same sex can get married. Some people do not think this is right. But it is not a big enough issue to change the constitution. The constitution should not be changed just to ban gay marriage.

It is not important enough to make a law that says who can and cannot get married. The government should not decide who is married and who is not.

I do not think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is a good idea.

I grew up in a Christian home. This makes homosexuality a difficult issue for me. I have many gay friends, but I do not totally agree with that lifestyle. However, I believe it should be allowed. I do not think it should be a national decision.

I think a state should decide for itself whether to allow gay marriage. Many states are democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states will likely support gay marriage. If you live in a state that allows gay marriage, you should respect that decision.

You chose to live in that state. If you do not agree with the decision, you can move to a different state. I believe homosexuals should be treated the same as heterosexuals. Each state should be able to decide about gay marriage.

I already answered that question. I do not think President Bush should decide what the whole country thinks about gay marriage. I believe it should be up to each state.

I do not agree with President Bush's ban on gay marriage. I think the president should not decide how each state should behave. He does not live in every state.

I think some things should be left up to each individual state. President Bush will be out of office soon. If a new president wants to lift the ban on gay marriage, it will just go back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

I do not have an opinion about that.

I don't agree with the school officials looking at students' Myspace pages. If you post something on the internet, you know it will be seen by others. This includes school officials. They can still find out what you are doing even if your Myspace page is not under the school's name. They can look at it from their homes.

But, I think it is okay if they look at Myspace to prevent school shootings. If they can save lives, that is a good thing. School officials have a responsibility to keep students safe.

It is like when they check the internet to see if students are doing things they shouldn't be doing. They do this to catch students who are doing something wrong. I think this is an invasion of privacy. But, if they can make the school a better and safer place, it is okay.

Everything on the internet can be seen by others. If you post something on Myspace, it will be there forever. This can hurt you later in life. If you do something wrong, it can be hard to get out of trouble.

School officials should not check Myspace just to catch students. But, if they have a reason, it is okay. Like when they make sure the school is safe. This is like when they practice lock downs to be ready for bad things to happen.

They did this to prepare for something like the Columbine school shooting. They wanted to keep students safe. I think this is what school officials were doing in this case. They were making the school a safer place.

I was for the war in Iraq at first. I thought it was a good idea to go there after nine eleven. But now I am against it. I think we had no plan and were not prepared.

We went to Iraq because of anger and emotion, not because we thought about the long-term effects. We did not think about what would happen after we arrived. As a result, things did not go well.

The people in Iraq fight among themselves. They cannot work together. If they fight each other, they cannot fight against us. We went to Iraq to help, but we are not making a difference. We are actually hurting ourselves by staying there.

War is different for them than it is for us. They use strong methods and are not interested in making their country better. They just want us to leave.

We went to Iraq looking for revenge. We wanted to punish them for what happened on nine eleven. But we should have thought about the consequences. We should have had a clear plan.

We cannot change the people in Iraq. They will always be the same. We cannot stay in Iraq forever. When we leave, things will get worse. So, it is better for us to leave now.

We have made some progress, but it is not enough. We are not doing enough good to stay in Iraq. We should just leave and stop hurting ourselves.
